title: Hello Quarto
text:
Quarto ‚Ä¶

is a new, open-source, scientific, and technical publishing system
aims to make the process of creating and collaborating dramatically better


Artwork from ‚ÄúHello, Quarto‚Äù keynote by Julia Lowndes and Mine √áetinkaya-Rundel, presented at RStudio Conference 2022. Illustrated by Allison Horst.

title: Hello Quarto
text:
Quarto ‚Ä¶
unifies + extends the R Markdown ecosystem

title: Hello Quarto
text:
Quarto ‚Ä¶
unifies + extends the R Markdown ecosystem

unifies for people who love R Markdown

title: Hello Quarto
text:
Quarto ‚Ä¶
unifies + extends the R Markdown ecosystem

unifies for people who love R Markdown
extends for people who don‚Äôt know R Markdown

title: Hello Quarto
text:
Quarto unifies + extends R Markdown


Consistent implementation of attractive and handy features across outputs: tabsets, code-folding, syntax highlighting, etc.
More accessible defaults as well as better support for accessibility
Guardrails, particularly helpful for new learners: YAML completion, informative syntax errors, etc.
Support for other languages like Python, Julia, Observable, and more via Jupyter engine for executable code chunks.

title: Hello Quarto
text:
Demo
If you‚Äôd like to follow along, go to
https://github.com/mine-cetinkaya-rundel/quarto-niss
and clone the repo to get started

title: Hello Quarto
text:
Your turn!

Go to https://github.com/quarto-journals/jasa
Follow the instructions under Creating a new article
Add your author details and render the document
Add a citation and re-render

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
For this analysis we‚Äôll use the penguins dataset from the palmerpenguins package.(Gorman, Williams, and Fraser 2014)





library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
library(palmerpenguins)
library(gt)




Figure¬†1 is a bar plot of species of penguins.

ggplot(
  penguins,
  aes(
    x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm,
    color = species, shape = species
  )
) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_color_colorblind() +
  labs(x = "Bill length (mm)", y = "Bill depth (mm)")

Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).





Figure¬†1: Scatterplot of bill depth vs.¬†length of three species of penguins showing a positive, linear relationship.







Table¬†1 shows the first 10 penguins from the dataset.

penguins |>
  slice_head(n = 10) |>
  select(species, island, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm) |>
  gt()

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Data


For this analysis we‚Äôll use the penguins dataset from the palmerpenguins package.(Gorman, Williams, and Fraser 2014)





library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
library(palmerpenguins)
library(gt)

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Species
?@fig-bill-dims-species is a bar plot of species of penguins.

ggplot(
  penguins,
  aes(
    x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm,
    color = species, shape = species
  )
) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_color_colorblind() +
  labs(x = "Bill length (mm)", y = "Bill depth (mm)",
       title = "REaaaaaaaaalllllllllllllllllllyyyyyyyyyyy loooooooooong title")

ggplot(
  penguins,
  aes(
    x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g,
    color = species, shape = species
  )
) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_color_colorblind() +
  labs(x = "Bill length (mm)", y = "Bill depth (mm)")

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
References






Gorman, Kristen B., Tony D. Williams, and William R. Fraser. 2014. ‚ÄúEcological Sexual Dimorphism and Environmental Variability Within a Community of Antarctic Penguins (Genus Pygoscelis).‚Äù Edited by Andr√© Chiaradia. PLoS ONE 9 (3): e90081. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0090081.
